Hice esta review en 2015 mas o menos y ahora en 2022 con mas de 103 horas de juego mantengo mi review. Aqui va mi yo del 2015:
Llevo mucho tiempo con esto de los videojuegos, y la verdad es que recién vengo a jugar Bioshock Infinite y sinceramente es obra maestra. 
-Personajes Memorables
-Armas Variadas y se acomodan a tu Gameplay (yo fui de Sniper y no tuve ningún problemas, cambié a revolver y RPG y tampoco).
-Elizabeth es una mujer fuerte que a lo largo del juego es Escencial.
-Distintos Poderes que no son obligatorios en su uso (menos el rayo en una parte pero nada mas)
-Historia Épica y Compleja que está muy bien narrada, ya que su ritmo es óptimo.
-Bellas Gráficas y un Soundtrack Memorable y a veces Curioso (en especial cuando se forma las roturas Espacio-Tiempo.
Simplemente una Bella Experiencia, Gracias.
An absolutely unforgettable experience, 11/10

Absolutely terrific game, especially when played in 1999 mode. I finished the game on hard my first time through and I found it too easy. I'm a lazy gamer, you have to force me to use spells and abilities otherwise I won't use them. The game was easy enough on hard that I just shot everything in sight, making my first run through the game not that interesting. But the characters, OMG. Elizabeth and Booker have amazing chemistry, and the voice acting is off the chains! 

So after my not that interesting first run, I played through the DLC in 1999 mode (hardest difficulty in the game, unlocked after finishing it once) and I LOVED IT! Now I couldn't just sit on my ass and shoot everything, I had to use every power at my disposal, I had to lay traps and lure enemies into them, I had to use the skylines (never really used them the first time around). The game truly came alive. 

But really the meat of this game is the story and characters. There are some issues; the game has some pretty racist undertones in the main game. They tried to rectify it in the second DLC but it felt kind of forced. Personally though it didn't really affect my enjoyment, I was just totally engrossed by the two main characters. I highly recommend Bioshock Infinite. Just make sure you play the game on the hardest setting you can handle!
One of the best single player experiences I have had.

10/10

Sometimes when a game has great gameplay you end up sacrificing a good story and vice-versa, but BioShock: Infinite has a great blend of both. Thought-provoking and interesting all the way through, this game is a must-play. The selection of weapons isn't extremely vast in this FPS, but is extensive enough to provide options without making the player feel overwhelmed. Vigors are a fun way to add magic to the game without making it seem like a mage-type feature similar to many RPG's. Elizabeth is a really well-balanced character that players will really feel attached to. Also, she is almost never in your way during a fight and instead actually makes herself useful by finding money and items like health and ammo throughout the game. She's definitely one of, if not my favorite sidekick. There are choices in the game which is always appreciated although they don't make a huge difference in the end. The ending is shocking, thought-provoking, and feels conclusive. +6 extra hours unrecorded offline.

BioShock Infinite, wow. This is a open worldish FPS with super powers. There is very little I didn't like about this game. BioShock Infinte does a fantastic job on all levels. The gun play was great, the sound was nice, the level design was very well done, and I found myself really interested in the story. The beginning is a little slow but it does it so much better than any other game I've played. Although, when the game gets going, it doesn't stop. So many new enviorments, so much action. I highly recommend this to any body who enjoys a great story, great shooting, and great design.

Bioshock infinite takes place in 1912 in the floating city of Columbia. Your name is Booker Dewitt and you have been hired by a man to retrive a girl from the city of columbia.

Gameplay: 10/10: Bioshock infinite is LOADED with lots of combat situations and exploration, gameplay i have to give a 10/10

Graphics: 9/10: This game looks visually stunning, it was made on a moddified version of Unreal Engine 3 which looks amazing, especially on PC where you get that 1080p 60fps.

Story: 9/10: Bioshock Infinite has one of the best stories IMO, it was never a chore to play and finish this game. I finished it in a 3 day weekend where each day i played for 4+ hours and in total i finished the game in 11 or so hours and i loved every minute of it.

Conclusion: 9/10: I give this game a 9/10 and i recomend it to any gamer. Personally, im not a big single player person, but this game was awesome to me.

Mit Bioshock Infinite schafft Irrational Games eine der großartigsten Welten der Videospielgeschichte, welche selbst auf mid-range Hardware mit beeindruckender Grafik und wunderschönen Bildern punktet, spinnt eine absolut fesselnde Story darum und spricht prekäre Themen wie Religion und Rassismus direkt an. Als Booker DeWitt reist man in die fliegende Stadt Columbia und erlebt eine Geschichte, welche mit jeder Minute faszinierender und unglaublicher wird. Dieses Meisterwerk gehört in jede Bibliothek, absolut empfehlenswert!

Все началось с того, как главный герой, Девит Букер, проиграл в казино и остался в огромном долгу. У него была дочь, Анна, о которой он не помнил. И вот появились те люди, которые могли избавить его от этого долга. Для этого Букер должен отправиться в "Колумбию" и доставить этим людям девушку взамен на возврат долга. В Колумбии Букеру предлагают переродиться, на что он соглашается. Он находит эту девчонку. Элизабет, так звали девчонку, умеет делать так называемые "разрывы" - что-то вроде окон в будущее. Девит замечает, что у Элизабет нет пальца. Она говорит, что не знает, что случилось с ним. Элизабет ненавидит своего отца за то, что он запер ее в башне, которую охраняет огромный железный "соловей". Дальше Девит и Элизабет пробираются к Комстоку, тому самому отцу, через разрывы преодолевая смерти нужных им людей. По ходу игры у Букера временами идет кровь из носа, когда он заходит в какой-либо разрыв. Тоже самое происходит с теми, кто умирал в реальном мире, а не в разрыве. При встрече Комсток говорит Элизабет, что Букер знает, что случилось с ее пальцем. Девит говорит, что вообще не имеет понятия о том, что говорит Комсток и убивает его. У Букера начинает течь кровь из носа. Затем он вместе с Элизабет убивает того железного соловья. Затем Элизабет хочет добиться правды и водит главного героя по разрывам разного времени. В одном из них они наблюдают картину, как Комсток отдает маленького ребенка неким людям в другой разрыв, Букер пытается остановить его, зная, что этот ребенок, его дочь - Анна. Но он не успевает и ребенку разывом отрубает палец.. Тут Букер понимает, что Элизабет его дочь. Он говорит Элизабет, чтобы та открыла разрыв туда, где Комсток еще не родился, чтобы не дать произойти всему, что уже произошло. Попадая в тот разрыв, он видит священника, который предлагает ему переродиться. Тут Девит понимает, что он и есть тот самый Комсток. Элизабет замечает это и топит его... Вообщем весь смысл игры - убить самого себя, о чем говорит Букеру еще живой Комсток из Колумбии. В игре очень глубокий сюжет, и не каждый сможет в него проникнуть...

I am not going to go over the details of the game, or its plot or mechanics, which you can read about elsewhere.  The nature of this game is such that almost any discussion of the story is going to result in spoilers.  The late Roger Ebert was famous (or infamous) for stating that video games could never be art because the direct influence of the player on the game itself undercuts what, for him, was the most important criterion of art--that there is an artist (or group of artists) who strives to communicate a specific idea to others through the artists exclusive manipulation of some medium (film, paint, clay, etc.).  BS:I proves him wrong as it conveys a very meaningful (and somewhat sad) story and it does so without eliminating all meaningful player interaction, as some games like Dear Esther had done.   BI:S may not be the best game-as-game (there are some minor issues with the combat mechanics, and, like all fps games, a certain amount of repetitiveness in battles), but it may be the best example of game-as-art or game-as-literature ever created.   While the game's head-on frankness in dealing with uncomfortable issues of race, religion, and 19th century jingoism have been widely discussed, and the subject of some controversy, these are essentially backdrop to the story of the protagonist/player, Booker DeWitt, and the most remarkable AI character ever created:  Elizabeth.  To say more of their relationship would be to give away too much.  I cannot think of any other game where you wind up emotionally invested in an AI character as much as in this game (Black and White is somewhat different because you yourself create the character).  Much has also been written about the end, but please don't read about that before playing.  It's part of the reason why you will want to play it again and when you do, you are likely to get chills that second time around when you finally start to get the full point of the game.  I would only say this:  that there is a "meta-game" at work that is truly brilliant,  BI:S is simply a marvel.

Ho completato Bioshock Infinite esattamente a due anni dalla data di rilascio.

Opera che mi rimarrà nel cuore per molto, molto tempo. Più che per il gameplay, che sostanzialmente non è variato molto dal primo capitolo, sono la storia, i personaggi, l'ambientazione e le tematiche di fondo ad essere state magistralmente orchestrate e messe in opera per regalarci un titolo che soffre forse proprio il suo dover essere videogioco, perché purtroppo molti lo giocheranno senza gustare tutto ciò che c'è intorno: i particolari e le raffinatezze estetiche e visive, le chicche che raccontano ancor meglio il mondo di gioco, le musiche.

Irrational merita un applauso da tutti i videogiocatori, perché sono opere come questa che portano un po' più su l'asticella.

Das zweite mal habe ich es bei einem Freund ausprobiert und wahr Geshockt (XD) weil es einfach was ganz anderes wahr wie wenn man nur zukuckt. Nun...  habe ich es mir selber gekauft und freue mich immerwieder dieses Spiel zu Starten!!!

The gameplay, the storyline, the characters, the atmosphere, everything in this game feel awesome.

Bioshock Infinite is a masterpiece as it's predecessors (Bioshock 1 and Bioshock 2) , with extreme graphics , sound effects and a very interesting storyline. It has a large variety of weapons and special powers , so you will never get bored of using the same weapon over and over again. The only disadvantage that I could find is that you can't save the game when you want to and you have to wait till the autosave. Generally , it is a game that you will enjoy playing and it is worthy of your time. It is recommended for experienced and unexperienced gamers alike. 9/10

Bioshock infinite is an astounding, riveting piece of art. I could have played through this game without shooting anything just to place myself in the story and the universe (added bonus turns out the gameplay is as compelling). Videogames have become the true pinnacle of higher artistic form and without delving into too much, this game is exemplary in proving that.

BioShock Infinite не связана сюжетно с предыдущими играми серии Bioshock, но содержит ряд схожих с ними тем и образов. Её действие происходит в 1912 году в вымышленном летающем городе Колумбия. Главный герой, частный детектив Букер ДеВитт, проникает в город в поисках девушки по имени Элизабет. Позже Букер и Элизабет оказываются в центре войны между властями города и мятежными рабочими. Благодаря сверхъестественной способности Элизабет создавать «разрывы» между параллельными мирами герои раскрывают мрачные секреты города и своего собственного прошлого.
Нельзя просто так пройти игру и не влюбиться в Элизабет.
